meanings.definition: To discontinue a session of a legislative body without dissolving it.
meanings.sent1: The Prime Minister decided to prorogate the parliament until further notice.
meanings.sent2: The Senate prorogated their meeting due to lack of quorum.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected power outage prorogated the council's gathering, much to everyone's dismay.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to prorogate time itself with his mesmerizing tricks.
meanings.sent5: The decision to prorogate the trial left the courtroom in suspense.

meanings.sent1: She had to prorogate her dentist appointment because of a sudden work meeting.
meanings.sent2: The school prorogated the exam to next week due to the snowstorm.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to prorogate the deadline failed when his boss caught on to his procrastination.
meanings.sent4: The delay in the flight prorogated their vacation plans, causing frustration.
meanings.sent5: The decision to prorogate the project launch was met with mixed reactions from the team.

meanings.sent1: The professor decided to prorogate the assignment deadline by a week.
meanings.sent2: The company prorogated the sale due to popular demand.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain prorogated the outdoor event, but everyone still had fun indoors.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to prorogate the joy in the room, making everyone feel happier.
meanings.sent5: The decision to prorogate the meeting allowed for more time to discuss important matters.
